# safe-compare

Constant-time comparison algorithm to prevent Node.js timing attacks.

For more information about Node.js timing attacks, see [https://snyk.io/blog/node-js-timing-attack-ccc-ctf/](https://snyk.io/blog/node-js-timing-attack-ccc-ctf/).

[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/safe-compare.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/safe-compare)
[![GitHub tag](https://img.shields.io/github/tag/Bruce17/safe-compare.svg)](https://github.com/Bruce17/safe-compare/releases)
[![Dependency Status](https://david-dm.org/Bruce17/safe-compare.svg)](https://david-dm.org/Bruce17/safe-compare)
[![devDependency Status](https://david-dm.org/Bruce17/safe-compare/dev-status.svg)](https://david-dm.org/Bruce17/safe-compare#info=devDependencies)
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/Bruce17/safe-compare/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://coveralls.io/github/Bruce17/safe-compare?branch=master)
[![Code Climate](https://codeclimate.com/github/Bruce17/safe-compare/badges/gpa.svg)](https://codeclimate.com/github/Bruce17/safe-compare)
[![Known Vulnerabilities](https://snyk.io/test/github/bruce17/safe-compare/badge.svg)](https://snyk.io/test/github/bruce17/safe-compare)
[![Build Status - Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/Bruce17/safe-compare.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/Bruce17/safe-compare)
[![Build Status - AppVeyor](https://ci.appveyor.com/api/projects/status/ounmeq5c4ajuu7g3/branch/master?svg=true)](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Bruce17/safe-compare/branch/master)


**Important Note:**

If you're using Node.js v6.6.0 or higher, consider using `crypto.timingSafeEqual(a, b)` from the `crypto` module.  `crypto.timingSafeEqual` only works with Buffers of equal length. This package handles strings of different lengths.


## Installation

```bash
npm install safe-compare --save
```


## Usage

```javascript
const safeCompare = require('safe-compare');

console.log(safeCompare('hello world', 'hello world')); // Output: true
console.log(safeCompare('hello', 'not hello')); // Output: false
console.log(safeCompare('hello foo', 'hello bar')); // Output: false
```

**Crucial Consideration:** The runtime of this function is directly proportional to the length of the *first* input string.


## Tests

```bash
npm test
```


## Comparison to Other Libraries

This package improves upon existing modules like `scmp` and `secure-compare`. It combines the best aspects of both, focusing on optimal performance and code clarity. The `scmp` library is generally faster when strings have different lengths, while `secure-compare` is more straightforward in its comparison logic. This package aims for a balance between these two approaches.
